chrono::MicroTime Class Reference
Inheritance diagram for chrono::MicroTime:

Documentation

The MicroTime class is used for keeping track of microsecond accurate time intervals. It uses a 32-bit value so it is good for 4B microseconds (or about 66 minutes).

It is very handy for converting between microseconds, milliseconds, and seconds. It also serves to remove ambiguity when specifying short time intervals.

For example:

void set_period(const MicroTime & micro_time); //un-ambiguous and nice code completion
void set_period(u32 value); //the units here are not clear
void set_period_milliseconds(u32 value); //this is better but adds complexity

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

chrono::MicroTime::MicroTime ( u32  microseconds = 0)
inline

Constructs a MicroTime object using a u32 value.

The default initial value is zero.

Member Function Documentation

static MicroTime chrono::MicroTime::from_microseconds ( u32  microseconds)
inlinestatic

Create a MicroTime object from a microsecond value.

This method is only provided for completeness. The following objects will be initialized with the same value because the constructor value assumes microseconds.

MicroTime time_from_usec(MicroTime::from_usec(1000));
MicroTime time_usec(1000);
static MicroTime chrono::MicroTime::from_milliseconds ( u32  msec)
inlinestatic

Create a MicroTime object from a millisecond value.

static MicroTime chrono::MicroTime::from_seconds ( u32  sec)
inlinestatic

Create a MicroTime object from a second value.

static MicroTime chrono::MicroTime::invalid ( )
inlinestatic

Returns a MicroTime object set to the invalid time.

bool chrono::MicroTime::is_valid ( ) const
inline

Returns true if the time is set to a valid value.

micro_time_t chrono::MicroTime::microseconds ( ) const
inline

Returns the value in microseconds.

u32 chrono::MicroTime::milliseconds ( ) const
inline

Returns the value in milliseconds.

chrono::MicroTime::operator micro_time_t ( ) const
inline

Returns the usec() value when the comipler wants to convert to an unsigned 32-bit value.

This allows times to be easily added, subtracted, and compared as a u32.

u32 chrono::MicroTime::seconds ( ) const
inline

Returns the value in seconds.
